result.execSummary:
The defendant Ervin Gathright Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/01/2015; alternate 6 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ervin Gathright Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 7/13/15.

Attorney Joseph Smith in court.   Defendant Ervin Gathright did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Possession of Marijuana contrary to section 13.102(c)(13)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered. Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- Fine totaling $267.50 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2015; alternate 6 days jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Smith in court.   Defendant Ervin Gathright did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states his client could not make it to court today and requests another date. Defense puts the offers on the record. Court will give another date in 3 weeks. Court will cancel the trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with attached witness list filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ervin Gathright in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a date to have this matter investigated and requests a jury status/jury trial date. Court grants request. Form given to Attorney regarding motions, jury instructions and witnesses. Files 15TR1398 and 15TR1399 to trail along.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reisha Mitchell appeared for attorney Joseph Smith.   Defendant Ervin Gathright did not appear.  Michele Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Video addressed by defense. State will put a note in their file regarding the video. Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Ervin Gathright in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
